ratings.comment: Honestly Prof. Miles is a great person, super nice, and makes lecture very enjoyable, but I've found now going into Chem 345 that the questions are more advanced in the way they are worded then on Miles exams. Prof. Miles makes Ochem easily understood by giving these questions in a very simple way, but this may be a set back from other classes.

Dr. Miles was an AMAZING professor who truly cared about every one of her students. She taught the WHY behind ochem instead of "just memorize this." She is generous with her office hours and I highly recommend attending at least once or twice a week if you want to succeed. Her tests are exactly like her practice exams. She made ochem seem doable.

She is very nice and lighthearted person, but was not very focused on teaching chemistry. All lecture material was pre class work, so it made it hard to ask questions when you were confused. She often spent class time singing, talking about her cats or looking at memes rather than doing chemistry. Nice person, but unfocused and not serious.

Professor Miles was truly an awesome teacher and person. She has online pre lecture which teach the material very clearly and tell you what you need to know. Dr. Miles also was the first teacher who was capable of realizing we have other classes and life outside of school and truly cares about how the students are doing. Would recommend!!!

She was AMAZING and really helped us understand the material instead of just memorizing it - which is very important in ochem. Her love for ochem shows every lecture. Would love to take a class taught by her again

Ochem is a very difficult course, but she makes it as simple as she can. She has a great spirit and is very understanding. As tedious as it might sound, watch all her lecture videos and write down everything that she writes. It is essential to go back and understand it because that is where she derives the questions on her exams from.

Dr Miles makes ochem a lot less scary!! The way she structures the class makes you learn the concepts rather than memorizing mechanisms, so I actually feel like I took away a lot of knowledge. Sometimes her lectures were disorganized, but there's also lecture videos. Make sure to go to office hours and get to know her too, she's hilarious.
Kelsey is amazing. Musician AND organic chemist :)

Unlike other professors for this course, she does pre-lecture videos where she goes over all of the information before class. These are a life saver. In class, we just go over extra confusing concepts and practice problems. Exams are EXACTLY like the practice tests. She makes ochem actually fun and cares about her students a lot.

Her class was itself easy, and she was a decent teacher. However, often times it felt lazy. I took it over the summer during COVID so potentially she just cared less. Often would cancel lectures and office hours because she had concerts with her band. One time an exam was ripped straight off of a practice test, which was both nice and sucked.
Genuinely cares for her students, and writes difficult exams but does have a generous curve in the class. Makes OCHEM feel a little more possible.

Professor Miles is the best chemistry professor (or professor in general) that I've ever had. She is so good at explaining complex topics and she makes learning fun. She is very lenient, but that doesn't stop her from effectively teaching the subject. I would 10/10 recommend taking one of her classes.

Dr. Miles is an excellent professor that I had the privilege of having her for two semesters of organic chemistry. Dr. Miles is a truly seasoned, and intelligent woman who is not afraid to make organic chemistry fun and interesting and is really dedicating to taking the stigma away from organic chemistry. We LOVE her!

Professor Miles is possibly one of the best professors I've ever had. She made the class fun and exciting, and she really cares about you as a student. Her cat makes regular appearances on the lecture videos, which was a huge incentive for me to keep up with lectures. Take her class if you can!

There was a lot of ungraded work. If you stay on track and do all the "optional" work, you will get an A. Kelsey Miles is very fun during office hours. She also makes lecture videos interesting by including some music and her cat. I was very sad to learn she will be returning to her music career. She is the best professor I've ever had.

Dr. Miles is easily the best professor I have ever had at UW. She cares so deeply about her students and does everything she can to help them succeed. I feel so lucky to have had her for 343 & 345. Her lecture videos are amazing and she holds super helpful office hours and review sessions. She made class fun (and I hate chem! I retook 343 with her)

Doctor Miles was a great professor and she made organic chemistry manageable. Her lectures were interesting and she explained the material well. Doctor Miles held many review sessions and was available outside of class too. However, her tests were very difficult and worth a lot of the grade.
Awesome class, awesome office hours, awesome humour, and awesome content.

Dr. Miles goes above and beyond with her lecture videos. Theyre concise and easy to follow. Problem sets/practice exams are consistent with the actual exams, which were tough but completely fair. Definitely go to office hours! Dr. Miles is very friendly. Shes very enthusiastic about the material and clearly cares about helping students learn.

Dr. Miles is truly a gem. She really cares about the well-being of students and their achievement in this course, which is a very hard course. Her office hours are always a great place to ask questions, I encourage people to always attend even if you don't have any questions. Ochem is hard and she makes it more bearable with her humor and Roadie!

Professor Miles fully understands organic chemistry but lacks on how to teach it during office hours and review sessions she would let a first year undergrad take charge and would ignore the rest of the students. She would also teach topics covered in 3rd semester chem and only confused us further as this was only semester one. Do not recommend.

I loved having her as a teacher she made O Chem fun while still giving you a solid foundation. She wants you to succeed. Though this class is a hard work if you put in the effort she will help you do well. I would 10/10 recommend her for o chem.

I can't believe it but after taking ochem with Dr. Miles I actually understood the concepts and did well on exams. Her worksheets are super helpful and definitely the reason I was able to do well. She's so fun and sweet 10/10 would recommend.

Dr. Miles is an amazing professor! Her lecture videos are clear and engaging. She consistently checks piazza and gives feedback and answers questions out of class time. As well as holds very helpful review sessions before exams. The only negative to her class is that there are few points to earn outside of exams. I would recommend taking this class

I would retake CHEM 345 just to have this woman be my prof again. She is the most outstanding Professor I have ever had. Effective, professional, sweet, motivated, useful, and UNDERSTANDABLE. Do yourself a favor and take her class, if you have the option. It makes life more tolerable.

She is awesome! Prof Miles really puts time into her lecture videos to make them fun and I honestly enjoyed watching them. OChem is hard no matter what but I would take this class with her again. She is so great

Dr. Miles is hands down the best professor I have ever had at UW-Madison. She not only put so much effort into every single lecture, but she made them entertaining and used props to explain concepts. She personally met with you if you had questions and was so hands-on. The class is hard, but she makes it much more enjoyable!

Dr. Miles is hands down my favorite professor at UW, and that's saying a lot considering I HATE ochem. She goes above & beyond to make the content interesting, and her office hours are very helpful. Everything is recorded. Her exams are tough, but she wants to push you! I got way more out of this class than just learning ochem. I love HER!!!

I loved Dr. Miles! She was very empathetic towards students and made sure she didn't assign too much. Her lectures were never over an hour long, and she made them interesting. Her office hours were always fun and super helpful. Chem 345 is a really tough class, but I think she made it manageable. I would HIGHLY recommend Dr. Miles.

Literally incredible. I would easily take another course if Dr. Miles taught it, and that's saying something because chemistry is SO not my thing. She cares about your learning so much and will go above and beyond to make sure you get something out of the class. Exams are tough, but it's worth it to have such an amazing professor.

one of the best professors Ive ever had extremely understanding genuinely wants us to do well class is well-organized only tests on things she has taught us she made organic chemistry fun instead of scary office hours and discussions are extremely helpful effective teaching style that is easy to follow and easy to learn
I think Dr. Miles is a newer professor but she is very disorganized. Her lecture videos are often not ready on time and posted late. Exams are unfair as they test things not taught in class.

She and her cat did the impossible. Made OChem 345 fun! She is a tough teacher, but she will do everything to make sure you understand the material. Phenomenal professor, I highly recommend any class of hers.
